Description: Shoulder sherd of Attic black-figured pottery small neck-amphora; on shoulder, frieze of tongues, alternate black and red.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Royal Pavilion & Museums, Brighton & Hove. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

The sherd belongs to the same vessel as Reading 26.2.76, 26.2.74-75, 26.2.77, British Museum 1965,0930.843, 1965,0930.844, 1965, 0930.845 and joins Boston 88.827. Williams, D. 'In the Manner of the Gorgon Painter: the Deianeira Painter and Others’, in Enthousiasmos. Essays on Greek and Related Pottery presented to J.M. Hemelrijk, ed. H.A.G. Brijder, A.A. Drukker and C.W. Neeft, 1986, 61-68, esp. 62-65, fig. 4.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.2005)
